channel.title: RNZ New Zealand Headlines
channel.description: The Latest New Zealand headlines from RNZ News

item.title: UK grants last-minute visa extension for stranded foreigners
item.description: Britain has announced another month's visa extension for foreigners struggling to leave the country because of travel restrictions in the Covid-19 pandemic.

item.title: Photo essay: South Auckland students rally for unity, inter-school peace
item.description: About 200 secondary students huddled on a South Auckland field, not for a rugby game or a cultural dance practice, but in a rally against inter-school violence.

item.title: Family of Sophia Crestani who died at Dunedin party pledge to better student life
item.description: An initiative to enhance student safety and unite the Dunedin community has been launched in memory of Sophia Crestani who died at a flat party last year.

item.title: Auckland Transport Devonport road: Surprise as community board rejects plan
item.description: Auckland Transport's $47 million plan to upgrade the only road in and out of Devonport could be dead in the water.

item.title: Buses catch fire in Dunedin
item.description: Two buses are burning in a rental car yard in Dunedin.

item.title: Explainer: Who pays, who's exempt from managed isolation fees
item.description: The government expects to recoup only about $10 million from its new managed isolation charges - a fraction of the scheme's $500m cost.

item.title: Family members who escaped isolation plead guilty
item.description: Four members of a family who absconded from a Covid-19 isolation hotel in Hamilton have all pleaded guilty in the Hamilton Youth Court.

item.title: Hawke's Bay to float setting up a climate mitigation unit
item.description: A climate mitigation unit could be set up at Hawke's Bay Regional Council if the community agree, but there is disagreement around the council table.

item.title: One dead in Marlborough SH1 crash
item.description: One person has died following a crash on part of State Highway 1 in Marlborough.

item.title: Lockdown legality case: Decision reserved on final day
item.description: The Crown has failed to make clear what the legal basis was for putting the country into lockdown, a lawyer challenging the move has argued in court.

item.title: Two new cases of Covid-19 in managed isolation today
item.description: There are two new cases of Covid-19 in managed isolation, and household contacts of a traveller to South Korea have all tested negative, the Ministry of Health says.

item.title: Former All Black lock Andy Haden has died aged 69
item.description: Former All Black lock Andy Haden has died aged 69 following a battle with cancer.

item.title: Court dismisses Phillip Smith suit against Corrections over rehabilitation
item.description: The High Court has thrown out a convicted murderer's claim that Corrections failed to provide him with adequate rehabilitation courses while in jail.

item.title: Isolation fee decision looms: Recovering Kiwi expat facing return home calls for compassion
item.description: A Kiwi in the UK forced to return home due to a medical condition says she cannot afford to pay for managed isolation when she returns and is calling on the government for compassion.

item.title: Mass masking 'key' to planning for new Covid-19 outbreak
item.description: Everyone in New Zealand should have a reusable fabric mask and know how to use it in the case of a resurgence of Covid-19, an epidemiologist says.

item.title: Govt reveals new bill to recover isolation fees
item.description: Megan Woods says legislation to allow the government to recover some of the costs for managed isolation and quarantine will be introduced to Parliament today.

item.title: Creswell defends bid to take from aquifer: 'there is no loss of mauri'
item.description: Supporters of an appeal to stop a major water bottling consent heckled from the public gallery of the High Court today.

item.title: Māori families feel ignored by Family Court judges - report
item.description: Most whānau Māori going through the Family Court feel ignored by judges and are left to navigate a confusing system without support, a new report has found.
